channel.title: [PI] Jar a Server [PI]
channel.description: How can i jar my server?? do i gotta like type in the url in commands promt to jar?

item.title: [PI] Jar a Server [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Ok you need a file called “AutoCacheDownloader” Usually named somthing like that atleast when you have this files it means you dont download the “Cache” in the server and it puts it to your c:\ drive and then it will download while your runing the .jar. Now once you have that done you need go to an FTP hoster (Host websites for your own HTML,PHP,ect.) Or find a webhost that will let you upload for them in my case its easyer to use an FTP, Once you have the FTP (I use zymic.com) then find somes HTML code and just upload your jar there pretty much ;D im not sure for that part you either need the HTML or you just need upload and center probley but for most part should be an easy tut when you find somones HTML code its like copy and pasting.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Jar a Server [PI]
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

You know what ill just get someone to do it for me…because i totally dont know what the hell you guys are saying

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Jar a Server [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Im confused now, if you want a webclient you need make a jar nothing server sided really needs to happen you only need an AutoCacheDownloader for you client and then make that client a .jar and upload pretty much to a FTP.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Jar a Server [PI]
item.dc:creator: @XxJtxX XxJtxX
item.description:
@XxJtxX wrote:

[quote=“Shadowspkin, post:10, topic:393010”][quote author=XxJtxX link=topic=490178.msg3584355#msg3584355 date=1304044151]

Why do you want to jar your server?

  1. For a webclient
    or
  2. So he looks cool for making his server a jar.
    or even
  3. Hes smart and knows there are linux and mac users and they can use .jar’s

@xJTxX look for a webclient TuT in the forums and you’ll find a jar maker in there requirments for making the webclient if not then look for another TuT

  1. He said for his server, not client.
  2. He wouldn’t look cool.
  3. They can just use .sh files. And why would a Linux/Mac user want to use a JAR’d server when they would have to go through the trouble of decompiling it?

And at your “@xxJTxX” thing, I made a webclient tutorial and I know how to use JAR Maker.

Anyway:

@OP: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FhoX8RbJeZs
JAR Maker download
[/quote]

Sorry that I read the “Server” Part wrong.
And I use jar files due to the fact you cant run .bat’s on linux (idk about mac but from what I heard you use .jar’s on it)
Also you have no idea how people make there client .jar so they look like they know how to code.
Oh and Lol I read your name instead of other guys
@wildskiller you should of told me client I didnt understand your post that easy ;D[/quote]I’m saying you can use .sh (shell) files in replacement to batch files.

@OP Did the links help?

Read full topic
